name: Stapleford Park

reviews.text: Can't comment on overnight stay.
reviews.title: Went for dinner

reviews.text: Attended dinner with very good friends. food and drink excellent- hotel very quiet, service not quite as attentive as you might like.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - very poor service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finding someone to give money to was difficult!
reviews.title: Was I expecting too much?

reviews.text: Would go again, but not sure it offered good value.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Georgian house and surroundings, lacked atmosphere

reviews.text: hotel and grounds are idyllic.
reviews.title: High end prices / low end service!
wonderful
reviews.text: Myself and my partner went to go and stay at this lovely country hotel on recommendation. And what an recommendation it was. From the beginning till the end. Did not want to leave. From the front office staff to the restaurant staff all very pleasant, food is very generous in size so go with an appetite. Pool area is amazing, just go into the pool first then into the jacuzzi otherwise the pool might feel cold if you do it the other way round.. Can not wait to go back, better start saving up now.

The drive is very imposing with at the head of it a most wonderful country house. The welcome was warm and efficient. Only 1 of our 2 rooms was available so we settled in the library for coffee. Excellent coffee with home made biscuits, what a lovely start in the wonderfully comfortable arm chairs.
reviews.title: Relaxing home away from home

reviews.text: We checked checked into the rooms and were pleasantly surprised to find a small decanter of sloe gin awaiting for us in the room.
reviews.title: Lovely spa break.

reviews.text: The spa treatments were excellent, with wonderfully knowledgeable therapists. And if you are struggling to get to or from the spa, someone will happily take you in the car.
reviews.title: Lovely character hotel let down by slow and poor service!

reviews.text: And if you have forgotten sturdy footwear, there are wellingtons by the door, and if you have forgotten a coat, you can borrow one of those too!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, woeful service
Lovely venue but..
reviews.text: This is a beautiful place to go and unwind. A superb Georgian house in acres of grounds with numerous opportunities for rural or health club activities. We enjoyed an overnight stay, looked after very well by the mostly young but charming staff. Full afternoon tea was as indulgent as you would expect. Other meals were a little disappointing. The 'Fine Dining' dinner menu suffered from being too fancy and, we thought, not well conceived. Too many conflicting ideas on a single plate. Also, a pre-dinner drink and one bottle of wine from a list with no reasonably priced items made a rather too significant increase in the bill. Breakfast buffet food was of excellent quality but had been sitting too long. The staff, because of their youth, however willing, were just not well enough informed or experienced. There was no sommelier for example so advice about the list was honest but unhelpful. We have considered (not seriously) going back with a hamper so that we could enjoy the place without having to pay rather too much for food and drink that don't match up to the promise of the property.

reviews.title: needs some proper management
reviews.text: there is a real problem with the management at Stapleford. There are endless staff around, very few of whom have any idea how to do their job. Time and again a waiter would appear at our table and say "have you ordered x" and we would say no as we had ordered y. Then on several occasions our orders did not appear until we had chased them. The food was generally good but unless one orders "fine dining" which is good but not worth £55 if one has two courses and cheese, the menu is like a pub menu. The drinks are crazily expensive. A double hendricks gin and tonic was £18.50, the most expensive drink I have ever had anywhere in the world. The staff were all friendly but there seemed to be no-one in control until Easter Sunday morning when an older woman who obviously knew what she was doing took over. all in all a great location spoiled by terrible service.

reviews.title: Afternoon Tea - good but missing the finer details
reviews.text: Although we enjoyed out visit to Stapleford Park I feel for such a grand hotel some of the finer details were missing. We were seated in the restaurant and although the service was fine I did not feel it was top notch. There seemed to be 2 very well trained serving staff and some others who were not as confident or professional. The food was fine and the scones of a very good quality. However the cups were something you'd expect to get at the motorway services and the sugar provided was in individual granule sachets. I just felt some nice bone china and coarse sugar lumps would have been more befitting and took the edge off the lovely teapots, strainers and cake stand. Also we were seated at 2.30 crossing over with the lunchtime diners. We were there for over 2 hours and in that time the two large tables either side of us were not cleared. I saw at least 5 different staff in the restaurant and felt somebody should have cleared the tables at some point. I really did like the surroundings and enjoyed the food but just felt things could have been done a little bit better.

reviews.title: Absolute Luxury in Leicestershire
reviews.text: This former stately home makes a sumptuous and palatial hotel. The decor is wonderful, the rooms beautifully converted. There is a golf course, a fitness suite and spa and a luxurious pool area with steam room, jacuzzi and sauna. The restaurant offers very high quality meals and super service. But is it really absolutely top notch ?

reviews.title: Peace and quiet
reviews.text: Well there are a few cracks in the beautiful picture, the pool was closed on the day we stayed although we were able to use the sauna. The room we stayed in was wonderful, but the latches on the window were broken (they are absolutely antique) and we couldn't get any ventilation. The menu in the restaurant was just not inventive enough for an establishment of this quality and the wine list had only one bottle under £30 with some up over £200. Sadly there were too many errors made by the breakfast team and service was woefully slow.

reviews.title: Afternoon Tea at Stapleford Park
reviews.text: Afternoon tea at Stapleford Park was a touch busy as there was a ride and drive event for a car company - which if they had told me on booking I would have chosen another day. Parking was a little difficult and it was raining. Cakes, sandwiches, scones all very good with fantastic home made jam but could not wait to get home for a hot cup of tea. Not rushing to go back and at £40 for 2 its not a cheap treat.

reviews.title: Terrible service
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for 1 night. The room was great but far too hot. Could not turn heating down. Windows were difficult to open. Service in restaurant/bar very poor. Ordered Thai curry and when it eventually turned up it was a bed of rice with chicken and no sauce. Sent it back, got the burger instead which was good but didnt eat until about 10pm. Drinks also took and eternity to arrive. The slow relaxed atmosphere was not for me. Staff friendly though.

reviews.title: where is the staff?
reviews.text: I just wanted to know were is the staff in this hotel? we stayed at the weekend and it seems like the hotel doesn't have staff every time we wanted something we had to go and find a member of staff to the point we have been told we are short of staff please bare with me it might take a little wile, we paying for good food and service the end of the day and this is not good.how ever the hotel it self is fantastic.

reviews.title: Anniversary treat...
reviews.text: This hotel looks amazing and is pretty good, our room whilst very nice was a long walk from reception and felt like we were in the staff area... The staff were very helpful, we also visited the spa which i can highly recommend, the restaurant was average (service and food) the highlight was afternoon tea which was exceptional, probably the best we have had.

reviews.title: A wow factor to start , but does it live up ?
reviews.text: The hotel is set in beautiful grounds and being greeted on entry made us feel special. Coffee while we waited was excellent. Ground floor was impressive and exactly what you expect from a grand house. Room was large and well appointed if a bit dull in decor. During the night we were glad of the extra blankets- it got very cold. service was precise but slow- 20 mins for a coffee. Food was superb, but again at breakfast coffe took ages and we had to ask twice- same goes for the toast.

description: Set in 500 acres, Stapleford Park offers a wide variety of country pursuits and leisure activities including shooting, riding and falconry. And after a day in the fresh country air, our house guests and members always look forward to a delicious, freshly prepared evening meal in one of our dining rooms and a night cap in the library. Our luxurious bedrooms, all individually designed, guarantee a good night’s sleep in style.
